name: Chicken Rolls

steps.text: Melt butter in a microwaveable bowl.
Add all other non optional ingredients and stir with a fork until combined.
Open rolls and fill each triangular piece with a spoon of the chicken mixture.  (use a small cookie scoop)
Roll up staring at the large end and tucking in sides.
If desired you can dip each roll in melted butter and then bread crumbs for a different outside texture.
Place filled rolls on a greased cookie sheet with the small end point facing down.  (this keeps it from lifting open during the baking process.
Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown.
Serve warm with chicken gravy.

notes: Chicken gravy can be made with a mix, or you can make it from water, chicken bouillon, and cream of chicken soup.  You can also make this dough instead of buying it using the Chicken Roll Dough Recipe and rolling it out in a circle, and cutting it into 8 equal triangular pieces like a pizza.

steps.text: Preheat Oven to 350 Degrees
Mix together butter (softened to room temperature) and brown sugar.
Add Egg and vanilla to butter mixture and beat until very smooth
Add in flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda to mixture and only mix until it is combined (don't overmix)
Stir in chocolate chips (don't have to use exact measurements)
Form into balls and place on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 9-11 minutes depending on cookie sheet and oven.

name: Homemade rolls

steps.text: Heat milk in the microwave until very hot.
Mix in a bowl the heated milk, water, sugar, butter, and egg until combined.
Add to this mixture instant yeast as well as half the amount of flour.
Add in salt and the rest of the flour to the above mixture stirring with a spoon until it is all mixed together and forms a soft but not sticky dough.
Then on a clean surface add a small amount of flour and dump the dough onto it.  Knead the dough for 10 minutes.

After kneading the dough well, take a large bowl and put a tablespoon of vegetable oil or melted butter in it and grease the sides of the bowl and place the kneaded dough in it.  Cover with a clean towel or plastic wrap works good if you spray it so the dough won’t stick to it.  Place in a warm area and let raise for 1 hour.
Shape the dough into Balls and place in a pan or on a cookie sheet and let raise till they are double in size.
Bake for 18 - 20 minutes on 350 degrees.

notes:
I assume you are using a hand mixer, spoon, or wisk.  the amount of flour you need to add to make this a dough will be too stiff for anything but a large mixer or a spoon so use a strong spoon!

You need to knead this dough for 10 minutes!  Its not hard just takes muscles.  You just fold push turn.  You can google how to knead dough by hand and there are lots of videos showing how to do it.

name: 7 Layer Dip

steps.text: Spread refried beans in an even layer in the bottom of your serving dish.  Place in the refrigerator while you make Fresh Guacamole.
Spread fresh guacamole in an even layer over the beans
Top with a layer of salsa.
In a medium bowl, stir together sour cream, taco seasoning, and lime juice.  Spread this mixture in an even layer over the salsa by dropping in small spoonfuls and flattening out to spread
Sprinkle with monterey jack cheese and cheddar cheeses in an even layer over the sour cream.
Top with shredded lettuce, green onions, tomatoes, and black olives.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips.  Best eaten fresh.

notes: Can store in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

steps.text: Preheat oven to 350°
Remove stems from the mushrooms and discard.
Place cream cheese in a mixing bowl and let it sit at room temperature for 5 to 10 minutes to soften.
Stir cream cheese until smooth.
Then add garlic, bacon, cheese, and parsley and mix together well.
Spray a shallow baking dish with pan spray.
Place mushrooms top side down into the baking dish and spoon cream cheese mixture into the mushroom caps.
Bake for 18 to 20 minutes until heated through and cheese is melted.
Serve immediately.
Mix ingredients together until smooth.
Chill for at least 30 minutes.
Serve with vegetables or chips.
Mix ingredients together until smooth
Chill for 2 hours.
Taste for seasonings, serve with vegetables.

name: Fruit Dip

steps.text: Using an immersion Blender or other blender, mix cream cheese until smooth.
Add yogurt, powdered sugar, and fresh jam.   Mix well.

notes: Strawberry Fruit Dip:  Use strawberry yogurt & strawberry jam.  For Raspberry Fruit Dip:  Use raspberry yogurt & raspberry jam.

steps.text: Blend ingredients together and serve as a fruit dip.

Cut top off jalapeno.  Cut the bottom off the green onion.  Place all ingredients into a blender except ⅔ cup of tomatoes.  Pulse until green onion and jalapeno are incorporated.  Do not over mix.  It will look slightly green.
Add the ⅔ cup of tomatoes and barely pulse. This helps to bring back the red color of the salsa.   Chill & serve.
Combine all ingredients and serve

name: Banana Bread

steps.text: Beat bananas in a mixing bowl until they are mashed and smooth.
Add all other ingredients into your bowl.
Mix just until blended.  (Do not overmix!)
Spray two bread pans with nonstick spray.  (I like to use glass bread pans for this.)
Divide the dough mixture between the two bread pans.
Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the loaf.
Let cool in the pans for 10 minutes.  Then remove the bread by turning the pan over onto a cooling rack and dumping the bread out.
Then turn loaves upright to cool.

notes: If you dump the loaves out without cooling for 10 minutes first, the bottom will stick to the bread pans and tear away from the loaf.

steps.text: Heat milk and butter together in a microwave until butter is melted and milk is warm.
Add the egg to this mixture and whisk thoroughly.
In your mixer bowl add 2/3 of the flour, the salt, baking soda, sugar, baking powder, and yeast.  Mix together.
Add milk mixture on low speed until moistened.  Then mix on high speed for 4 minutes
Change to the dough hook and gradually add the rest of the flour and knead on speed 2 or a higher speed for 4 minutes.
Put dough in an oiled bowl and cover with a towel or sprayed wrap or tin foil.  Let rise until double.

Divide the dough into two equal pieces and roll each piece out into a large circle.  Then cut into 8 pieces like a pizza.  Fill with chicken mixture and roll up.  Let rolls sit for 15 minutes before baking to allow the doughs to raise a bit after being filled.
Preheat the oven to 350°.  Spray a 9 x 13 cake pan or 12 cup muffin tin.
In a large bowl, combine 2 cups flour, white sugar, baking powder, ½ tsp cinnamon, and salt.
In a small bowl, whisk milk, eggs, and melted butter until well blended
Stir wet ingredients into dry ingredients mixing only until moistened.  (Do not overmix)
Place batter in cake pan or muffin tin.

To make the topping, combine ½ cup flour, ¼ cup brown sugar, 1 ½ tsp of cinnamon, and ¼ cup of butter softened in a bowl and mix with a fork, whisk, or pastry cutter until the mixture is crumbly.  Sprinkle over cake or muffins.
Bake for 13-16 minutes or until golden brown
Drizzle with white frosting if desired.  Serve warm.

name: Crepes

steps.text: Add ingredients into a blender.
Blend for 30 seconds on high speed.
Scrape down the sides of the blender.
Blend for another 30 seconds.

Let the batter sit. (For best results at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.)  NOTE:  This makes working with the batter a little easier when cooking, but I often skip this step as I am making them when I don’t have time for this.
Heat a comal type pan on medium high heat.  Spray with pan spray for the 1st one you cook.  (on my comal I never need to spray again, but your pan could be different)
Pour a small amount of batter on the center of the pan and swirl the pan causing the batter to spread out and make a thin large crepe.
Cook until the edges look a little dry.  Then flip with a large spatula using one fluid motion under and then flip.
Cook the other side and then slide off onto a plate.  Serve with fresh fruit and cream.

notes: NOTE:  When cooking for our whole family, I triple this recipe.

steps.text: Drain and rinse the black beans.
Cut chicken into narrow strips.  Saute the chicken in a large soup in the butter or olive oil with the garlic and onions until cooked.  Using scissors, chunk chicken.

Add to the chicken mixture the tomato sauce, green sauce or green chilis, drained black beans, corn including juice, chili powder, cumin, and chicken broth. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5-10 minutes.
While the soup is simmering, add the velveeta cheese stirring so the chunks melt completely. (optional step)
Add whipping cream and bring back to a boil.
Remove from heat and stir cheddar jack cheese.  Garnish and serve with sourcream, chips, and more grated cheese

name: Christmas Punch

steps.text: Place all ingredients in a large punch bowl or divide ingredients equally into two gallon pitchers.  Stir well and serve.

notes:
NOTE:  Another way to make this.  This way calls for no water, no vanilla, double the soda and orange juice and adds pebble ice.

In a large punch bowl add 2 12 oz cans of thawed orange juice, (or one of orange juice and one of pineapple juice),  1 12 oz can of lemonade, sugar, 1 T almond extract, and 1 2 liter bottle of Lemon Lime Soda.  Stir well.  Add a 2nd bottle of Lemon Lime Soda and one 8 lb bag of pebble ice.

name: Fettucine Alfredo

steps.text: Add water to a large pot and bring to boil.  Add noodles and cook according to the package directions.
In a saucepan, on medium low heat, melt butter and cream cheese stirring with a whisk until melted.
Add all other ingredients.
Cook slowly on medium heat until the mixture just starts to boil.  Stir often so the sauce does not burn.
Remove from the heat and let the sauce sit for 5-10 minutes.  It will thicken as it begins to cool during this time.
Stir and serve warm over drained noodles.

notes: NOTE:  Use shredded parmesan cheese for this recipe.  Using dry cheese such as Kraft will result in a sauce with a very grainy texture.  Optional:  Garnish with more grated cheese and fresh or dried parsley.

steps.text: Cook rice & chicken according to package directions.
Prepare beans by snipping ends, cut the carrots, cut the green onion, and slice the cabbage thinly.

In a small saucepan, combine garlic, vinegar, honey, chili sauce, ketchup, brown sugar, sesame oil, soy sauce, and cornstarch with a whisk and bring to a boil.  Turn down the heat and simmer until thickened.  Divide into 3 parts
Stir fry vegetables beginning with the beans and carrots and adding cabbage at the end.  Stir in ⅓ of the sauce.

Cut chicken strips and coat with ⅓ of the sauce.  Put rice on the bottom of the platter.  Cover rice with vegetables.  Add Chicken on top and green onions.  Sprinkle with sesame seeds and drizzle with the rest of the sauce.
Add liquids to the blender first so you can use the measuring lines on the blender for your measurements.
Add all other ingredients into the blender, adding ice always last.  Blend until smooth
Slightly thaw peaches in the microwave for 1 minute and break into smaller chunks.
Add the milk first to the blender using its measuring lines.  Then add all other ingredients and blend until smooth.
Chop tomatoes and combine with all other ingredients.
Place on a toasted baguette slices and top with parmesan and mozzarella cheese.  Broil until melted.
Pulse basil, spinach and nuts in a food processor.
Add garlic and cheese and pulse several more times
Stream in olive oil while the food processor is running.  Adding slowly helps it emulsify.  Stir in salt and pepper to taste.
Cut, peel, and pit avocados and place in a medium sized bowl.  Add the lime juice and salt and mash avocados.
Mix in onions, tomatoes, garlic & cayenne Pepper.  Stir.
Refrigerate for 1 hour for best flavor.  Serve.
Place undrained tomatoes and cheese in a saucepan on medium heat and cook for 5 minutes until cheese is melted and sauce is creamy.  Add milk if too thick.

name: Hot and Cheesy Spinach Artichoke Dip

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 375°.
Chop spinach, pepper, and artichokes to desired size.
In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese.  Add sour cream and mayonnaise and mix until smooth and fluffy.
Stir in garlic, spinach, artichokes, peppers, parmesan cheese and 1 cup of mozzarella cheese.
Add basil, parsley, paprika, pepper, & lemon juice and stir.
Spoon into a sprayed baking dish and spread out evenly.
Top with the rest of the mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 20-22 minutes uncovered until dip is hot, bubbly, and golden on top.
Serve with baguette slices.
Wash, core, and put tomatoes in boiling water to split skins.  Then put in cold water to cool and peel.  Squeeze tomatoes to seed and get some water/juice out of them.
Place tomatoes in a food processor and chop to the consistency you like.  Then strain out excess water, and measure out 10 cups into a large pot.
Weigh onions, peppers, jalapenos, and cilantro and chop in a food processor as well.  Add to the tomatoes.
Add all other ingredients except for citric acid.
Bring to boil, stirring occasionally.
Bottle, add citric acid ¼ tsp per pint, ½ tsp per quart to top of bottle.  Then lid and process for 25 minutes for pints, and 50 minutes for quarts in a water bath canner.
In a measuring cup, combine milk and lemon juice.  Let sit for 5-10 minutes.  (This is what I make to substitute for buttermilk.  However you could use just one cup of buttermilk if you have it.)
Pour milk/lemon mixture (called sour milk) into a saucepan and add butter and sugar and stir to combine.
Bring to a boil and reduce heat.  Boil for 3-5 minutes stirring frequently.
Remove from heat and add vanilla and baking soda stirring continuously.
The mixture will foam up but continue stirring until everything is mixed together well.
Serve warm.
Store in the refrigerator.
In a large pot, saute onion and garlic in olive oil until onions are transparent.
Prepare green pepper, jalapeno, tomatillos, and cilantro and place in a blender.
Add to the vegetables in the blender the sauteed onions and garlic and the broth.  Blend until smooth or the texture you desire.
Transfer blended sauce into the large pot and add salt and cumin.
Simmer on medium for 10-15 minutes or until the sauce has boiled down and reached your desired consistency.
Use this sauce for enchiladas or in making chicken enchilada chili soup.

name: Sweet & Sour Sauce

steps.text: In a small saucepan, combine brown sugar and cornstarch with a whisk.
Add all other ingredients except food coloring.
Cook on medium high heat stirring occasionally with a whisk until mixture begins to boil and thicken.
Boil for 1 minute then turn off heat.
Add food coloring if desired.
Serve warm.

notes: This sauce can be used for Sweet & Sour Chicken or as a dipping sauce for gyozas, egg rolls, etc.

steps.text: Place everything but the salt and cilantro in your electric pressure cooker and set to pressure cook for 50 minutes.
Slow release for another 15-20.
Drain if needed and add lime juice and cilantro.
Salt if needed.  Serve.
Drain and rinse beans.  Place all ingredients into a saucepan.  Bring to boil.  Reduce heat and simmer for 5-10 minutes on medium to low heat.
Serve Warm
In a saucepan, put rice, butter, garlic, broth, water, and tsp of lime juice and bring to a boil.  Cover, turn to low and cook for 15 minutes until rice is done.
Mix Tbsp lime juice, sugar, and fresh cilantro together and pour on cooked rice and stir in.  Serve.
In a saucepan, put rice, butter, garlic, broth, water, and lime juice and bring to a boil.
Cover, turn to low and cook for 15 minutes until rice is done.

name: Au Gratin Potatoes (Hashbrown)

steps.text: Melt Butter
Mix butter, soup, milk, sour cream, salt, pepper, and dried onions together in a bowl.
In a separate bowl, mix hash browns and 1 ½ cups of cheese together.  Pour soup mixture over hash browns and stir together.
Pour soup mixture over hash browns and stir together.
Spray a 9 x 13 pan.
Put potato mixture into the pan and top with the leftover ½ cup of cheese.
Cover with tin foil and bake at 350° for 1 hour.

notes: You can mix all the cheese with the potatoes and then make this alternative topping if desired.  2 T butter mixed with 1 ½ cups of crushed corn flakes.  Top the casserole with this mixture.  Do not cover.  Bake.

name: Homemade Refried Beans

steps.text: Bring beans and water to a boil and boil hard for 5 minutes.  Pour off this water and add the same amount of clean water and bring to a boil.  Turn heat down to medium low, cover beans, simmer for 2 ½ to 3 hours.

When beans are tender, melt shortening in a frying pan and add flour.  Stir until flour has browned.  While still hot add 1-2 cups of beans and liquid.  Stir until mixed and then add this back to the other beans.  Add salt to taste and cook on medium low for 30 more minutes.

To make “Refried Beans,” heat 2 T of shortening in a skillet.  Add 1-2 cups of cooked beans and mash with potato masher.If you are using these for a burrito filling, add some dry taco seasoning to the beans and cook until thickened.

notes: TO MAKE THESE USING AN INSTAPOT:  Soak beans in water overnight and it will only take 20 minutes to cook.  Non soaked beans take 40 minutes to cook.  Place 2 cups of beans in your pot and cover with water by 1” or more.  Put in whole pieces of onion that will be easy to remove.  Cook on high pressure cook for the time listed above.  Drain out extra water (leaving a little with the beans.  Remove onion.  Use a stick blender to mash.  Add 2 tsp salt, 2 tsp cumin, 1 T oil, ½-1 tsp garlic powder.   Serve warm.

steps.text: Spread the white rice in a 9 x 13 pan.
Sprinkle the wild rice over the top of the white rice.
Sprinkle salt, soup mix, and bouillon evenly over the rice.
Cut butter into small flat squares and place on top of rice.
Pour water over rice.
Cover with aluminum foil and seal tight.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
Whisk together in a mixing bowl the yeast, water, and FIRST flour until smooth.  Let stand for 10 to 15 minutes.  (Should look foamy on top.)
Add FIRST egg, melted butter, sugar, and salt and mix together.
Switch to a dough hook and add SECOND flour a cup at a time.
Knead for 6 minutes.  (This dough is very soft and somewhat sticky.)
Put dough in an oiled large bowl and cover with aluminium foil and raise until double in size.

Spray your work surface with non-stick spray and roll dough out into a rectangle.  Cut into 8 equal parts.  Form into a disk and flatten to ⅝ inch thick.  Arrange on a cookie sheet in a 2-1-2-1-2 pattern.  Cover and rise for 1 hour.
Whisk SECOND egg and milk and lightly brush on top without pushing down and then sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Bake at 350° for 15-17 minutes until golden brown.  Cool.

name: Homemade Tortillas

steps.text: Heat water to almost boiling in a microwave.
Add all ingredients into your mixer.
Using your dough hook, mix together and then knead this dough for 1 minute.
This dough should be very soft and pliable but not sticky.  Tweak the amounts slightly of flour or water to get that consistency.
Let the dough rest for 5 minutes.
Roll out dough into a rectangle and cut into 16 equal pieces.  Make each piece into a flat disk
Roll each disk into a tortilla.
Heat up your pan.
Cook tortillas on one side until bubbles start to form.  Flip and cook on the other side.  Wrap in a white dish towel immediately after removing from the pan to keep soft.

notes: NOTE:  Secrets for success are HOT WATER, and when rolling them out remember flour is your friend.  Don’t be afraid to use it.   I cook my tortillas on a comal type pan.  For whole wheat tortillas use fine ground wheat flour.

steps.text: Heat drinking water in the microwave for 1 ½ minutes.  (Bath water 105° temperature.  Too hot destroys the yeast, and too cold increases the rising time.)
Pour the heated water into the mixer and add yeast, sugar, oil, most of the flour, and the salt on top of the flour.
Using the dough hook, begin mixing the dough.  It will start to form a dough that is a bit sticky.
As it mixes the first minute, continue adding small amounts of flour until the dough is soft but completely pulling away from the sides and center of the bowl.
Knead on speed 2 for 8-10 minutes.  Spray 3 standard size loaf pans with nonstick spray.  Divide dough into 3 equal pieces, form into loaves, and place in bread pans.
Cover with a cloth and let rise until the dough is slightly above the top of the pan.  Put into a non preheated oven.
Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.  Remove bread from pans immediately (so it doesn’t sweat) and cool on a rack
In a 2 cup glass measuring cup dissolve yeast and (tsp) sugar into the warm water and set aside.
Combine in your mixer the milk, (cups) sugar, salt, shortening, and potato flakes.  Then let cool for about 5 minutes.
Beat eggs in a separate bowl with a whisk.
Add beaten eggs and yeast mixture to the other ingredients in your mixing bowl and turn on low speed.
While mixing, begin adding the flour 1 cup at a time until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl.
Knead the dough on medium speed for 5 minutes.
Place dough in a large bowl and cover.  Let rise for 1 hou
Knotted rolls:  Separate dough into 3 pieces and roll each into a rectangle.  Butter surface, fold in half, cut in strips.  Tie strip into a knot and tuck under ends.
Crescent rolls:  Roll into 3 circles.  Cut each into 8 pieces and roll up-large end to small end tucking tip underneath.
Place on a cookie sheet, let rise 1 ½ to 3 hours.  Bake at 375° for 12 minutes.  Brush rolls with butter after cooking.  Note:  Can use this recipe for cinnamon rolls.

name: Wheat Bread (Magic mill)

steps.text: Grind 5 cups of wheat berries.
In a mixer using a dough hook, add water, dough enhancer, lemon juice, sugar, and oil and begin mixing.
Add in this order while mixing is running:  1/2 the wheat flour, Salt, and yeast and let this mix in good.

Add the rest of the wheat flour, one cup at a time until your dough reaches the desired consistency.  (Dough should be coming off the sides of the bowl at this point  but still be a fairly soft elastic dough.
Knead dough for 6-8 minutes.
Form into loaves, let rise, and bake at 325° for 25 minutes.
Remove from pans and let cool on a rack.

notes: NOTE:  This dough can also be used for whole wheat pizza crusts, whole wheat pitas, or whole wheat cinnamon rolls.  See pizza dough, pita, and cinnamon roll recipes for baking instructions.

name: Pizza Dough

steps.text: Place all ingredients into a mixing bowl with a dough hook.  I like to start with the water, yeast and sugar first.  Then add the oil, flour, and salt on the top of the flour.
Mix together and then knead for 6-8 minutes.
Roll out 3 large pizza skins for regular crust.

notes: NOTE:  If you are using this for a thicker crust, it will make 1 less pizza.   You may also use this dough for breadsticks.

name: Sweet Cornbread

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 350° and spray a 9 x 13 cake pan.
In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate microwaveable bowl, melt butter.
Add the eggs to the utter and whisk until smooth.
Add milk and oil and whisk until well combined.
Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture.  Stir just until blended.  DO NOT OVERMIX.  Doing so makes the cornbread heavy
Quickly and gently place batter in the pan spreading it out even with the least amount of pressure so as to not break the air bubbles that are forming.
Bake for 15-22 minutes until lightly golden brown.

notes: NOTE:  You can make your own cornmeal from popcorn kernels by grinding a scant ⅓ cup of kernels in your wheat grinder on a medium to fine setting.  That will make the ½ cup of cornmeal.

name: Sweet Dinner rolls

steps.text: Dissolve yeast in warm water in a mixing bowl.
Mix in milk, sugar, shortening, egg, half of the flour, and salt using your whisk or paddle beaters.  Beat ‘til smooth.
Change to a dough hook and mix in the rest of the flour.  Dough should be soft.  Do not add too much flour
Knead for 6-8 minutes.
Place dough in an oiled bowl and cover and let rise until at least double
Form dough into dinner rolls.  Cover and let rise.
Bake at 350° for 18-20 minutes until golden brown

notes:
Cinnamon Rolls:  Roll out dough in a rectangle.  Spread with 4 T of softened butter.  Sprinkle with Brown Sugar & Cinnamon.  Roll, cut, place on cookie sheet, cover,  rise, and bake.  Frost.

Orange Rolls:  Beat 6 T of butter with 2 T Orange Peel and 4 T Orange Juice and 3 cups Powdered Sugar until smooth.  Roll dough into a rectangle.  Spread ½ of the orange mixture on dough.  Roll, cut, place on cookie sheet, cover,  rise, and bake.
Spread with the rest of the orange mixture

steps.text: Heat water to 105° (bath water temperature)
Add water, yeast, and half of the white flour to your mixing bowl and mix with whisks until combined.  Let sit for 10 minutes.

Change to the dough hook.  Then add all other ingredients to your mixing bowl placing the dough enhancer and the salt on top of the remaining flour.  Start with adding only 3 cups of wheat flour.  Then add more if needed.
Knead dough for 6 to 8 minute of medium speed.
Roll out dough into a rectangle on a floured surface until it is 1” thick.  Cut with a pizza cutter into the shape you desire and separate pieces so when they raise they do not join each other.
Let scones rise for ½ to 1 hour.
Lightly brush off flour and fry in oil at 350° with the side that was facing up while rising being placed face down in the oil.   Cook for 1 -2 minutes on each side.
Preheat the oven to Bake 375°
Spray two bread pans.
Finely grate zucchini and measure out correct amount of cups and place in the mixing bowl
Add eggs, brown sugar, white sugar, oil, and vanilla and mix.  (I do this in my mixer with whisk attachments.)
Add all remaining ingredients and fold in. (meaning mix only until ingredients are incorporated.  Do Not Overmix.)
Pour batter into the two bread pans and bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Let cool for 10 minutes and then remove from pans and cool the rest of the way on a cooling rack.
